oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of autumn kaolin, pyrethrin, and ladybird larvae (Adalia bipunctata) applications on the spring populations of the rosy apple aphid (Dysaphis plantaginea) in an experimental apple orchard (cv. Glockenapfel)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wyss, Eric
Daniel, Claudia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Effects of different strategies (insecticide treatment, physical barrier, biocontrol) to control autumn forms of Dysaphis plantaginea.
Question 1: Efficacy of pyrethrum, kaolin, and larvae of A. bipunctata to control Dysaphis plantaginea.
Question 2: Date of application and number of applications for a valuable efficacy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Wyss, Eric and Daniel, Claudia (2003) Effects of autumn kaolin, pyrethrin, and ladybird larvae (Adalia bipunctata) applications on the spring populations of the rosy apple aphid (Dysaphis plantaginea) in an experimental apple orchard (cv. Glockenapfel). Product Evaluation (Mittelpr√ºfungsbericht). FiBL Research Institute of Organic Agriculture, Frick.
